title: 110_hr1376
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Act establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage, with amendments to the Social Security Act and conforming amendments. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of the Social Security Act related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments include changes to subsections (a)(10), (cc)(2)(A)(I), (f)(4), and (a)(2)(B) of the Act. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents, including changes to subsections (a)(10), (cc)(2)(A)(I), (f)(4), and (a)(2)(B) of the Act. The amendments involve replacing references to "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XIX)" with "1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII)" in multiple sections of the Act. Amendments made to the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents will apply to calendar quarters starting on or after October 1, 2007, regardless of final regulations. States needing legislation for compliance with the amendments will not be penalized if they meet the requirement after the first regular session of the State legislature following the enactment of the Act. In a State with a 2-year legislative session, each year is considered a separate regular session of the State legislature.
